text:
Code
library(tidyverse)


── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
✔ dplyr     1.1.4     ✔ readr     2.1.5
✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.1
✔ ggplot2   3.5.2     ✔ tibble    3.2.1
✔ lubridate 1.9.4     ✔ tidyr     1.3.1
✔ purrr     1.1.0     
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors


Code
library(gt)
library(wehoop)


turnovers <- read_csv("Turnovers forced per game in the NBA - Sheet1.csv")


Rows: 30 Columns: 8
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr (1): Team
dbl (7): Rank, 2024, Last 3, Last 1, Home, Away, 2023

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.


Code
turnovers2024 <- turnovers |>
  select(Team, "2024")


OKC <- turnovers |>
  filter(
    Team == "Okla City"
  )

ggplot() + 
  geom_bar(data=turnovers2024, aes(x=reorder(Team,`2024`), weight= `2024`)) +
  geom_bar(data=OKC, aes(x=reorder(Team, `2024`), weight= `2024`), fill="blue")  +
  coord_flip() +
    theme_minimal() +
labs(
    x="Teams", 
    y="Turnovers forced per game", 
    title="Thunder were good against the bad, but elite against the great", 
    subtitle="The leagues turnovers forced per game were quite impressive with Thunder among the elite in the sport.", 
    caption="Source: Sports Reference | By Trey Stevens"
    ) +
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 20, face = "bold"),
  axis.title = element_text(size = 8), 
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size=10), 
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank()
    ) 











Code
library(tidyverse)
library(gt)
library(wehoop)

tov <- read_csv("tovrank(in).csv")


Rows: 10 Columns: 4
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr (2): TEAM, SEASON
dbl (2): RANK, OPP TOV

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.


Code
tov |> 
  select(RANK, TEAM, SEASON, `OPP TOV`) |>
  gt()|>
 cols_label(
    RANK = "Rank",
    TEAM = "Team",
    SEASON = "Season",
    `OPP TOV` = "Opponent Turnovers",
  ) |>
  tab_header(
    title = "Does Nebraska have a chance to be special this season?",
    subtitle = "Amy Williams' team is near the middle of a tough conference where it matters most."
  ) |> tab_style(
    style = cell_text(color = "black", weight = "bold", align = "left"),
    locations = cells_title("title")
  ) |> tab_style(
    style = cell_text(color = "black", align = "left"),
    locations = cells_title("subtitle")
  ) |>
  tab_source_note(
    source_note = md("**By:** Trey Stevens  |  **Source:** wehoop: The SportsDataverse's R Package for Women's Basketball Data")
  ) |>
  tab_style(
     locations = cells_column_labels(columns = everything()),
     style = list(
       cell_borders(sides = "bottom", weight = px(3)),
       cell_text(weight = "bold", size=12)
     )
   ) |>
  opt_row_striping() |> 
  opt_table_lines("none") |>
 
  data_color(
    columns = vars(`OPP TOV`),
    colors = scales::col_numeric(
      palette = c(
        "white", "orange", "red"),
      domain = NULL)
  )


Warning: Since gt v0.9.0, the `colors` argument has been deprecated.
• Please use the `fn` argument instead.
This warning is displayed once every 8 hours.


Warning: Since gt v0.3.0, `columns = vars(...)` has been deprecated.
• Please use `columns = c(...)` instead.
